reasoning: As written, the critique does not attack the position; it largely restates and endorses the position’s own counterarguments (that manufacturing-based CES substitution estimates for ρ may not transfer to AI R&D due to smarter/faster labor, improving experimental efficiency, and multiple routes to progress). Therefore it has ~0 centrality and correspondingly ~0 strength against the position. The content is broadly plausible (hence moderate correctness), but it is high-level and underspecified (moderate clarity). It is concise with no fluff (low dead weight) and is focused on a single overarching point about transferability (high single-issue). Overall, it poses essentially no problem for the position.
title: AI R&D's unique properties invalidate cross-domain estimates of diminishing returns
